instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 boards same problem
threads.message:
2 boards same customer, one is clean the other one has some corrosion but nothing bad weird thing is that they both have the same simptoms.

Boards start up, fan spins, I get 1.8v on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> fan spins for about 5-6 seconds, stops then starts again this time stays on and draws about 0.130a steady but there is no USB activity.

I tried clean ME BIOS and same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 boards same problem
threads.message:
Some other history about what happened?
Especially for the clean board.

Do you get all voltages from pages 57/58?
Also check at L/C blocks near CPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 boards same problem
threads.message:
Customer states that Mac was taking a long time to load the OS and sometimes it would not load at all, then one day they both started to not turn on at all, both are machines used in a company all day long.

All Caps and Coils above CPU measure 1v when board is running except for <CAPACITOR>C1031</CAPACITOR> 1.8v for <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>

If you mean page 100 or sheet 62 (Power Aliases) of schematic for board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> then yes, I have checked and all voltages are present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 boards same problem
threads.message:
I mean pages 57/58; Power FETs and Misc Power Supplies...

Try full known good working BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 boards same problem
threads.message:
Thanks for the baby steps, all voltages are present from pages 57/58

I have now tried 2 know good bios and even swapped the BIOS chip from another board same model (Dirty ME) just for testing and the board behavior is the exact same.

I have done the same thing on both boards and same result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 boards same problem
threads.message:
Did you try both USB ports?

Connect speaker to the board and check if beeps RAM error.

You can try heating CPU with quality flux, may be corrosion problem...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 boards same problem
threads.message: Same problem on both ports, no sound at all during startup.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 boards same problem
threads.message:
Heated CPU with good quality flux and same thing, this Macs are going back to customer.

Thanks for your time and help.
